subtasks: Gather the necessary equipment (green clover, brush, rope, bucket)
Train the cow to remain still (use rope around neck, give treats, use commands)
Clean the cow's udder and teats (wipe with warm water, dry with old nappy)
Apply coconut oil to teats and discard initial milk
Milk using the stripping method (ensure proper direction to avoid pushing bacteria into udder)
Manage the cow's movements throughout the milking process
Maintain the cow's comfort and relaxation (giving scratches, singing, soothing presence)
Ensure proper handling of the bucket to prevent contamination
Adjust milking technique for teats with cuts or issues
Provide post-milking treats and supplements (loosened with mineral mix)
